replacement_map.disadvantaged urban communities: urban communities with limited healthcare access
replacement_map.diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei),: broad participation in research and healthcare solutions.
replacement_map.racial disparities,: differences in health outcomes across populations with varied access to care.
replacement_map.historically marginalized communities,: communities with systemic barriers to healthcare access.
replacement_map.addressing biases,: ensuring research reflects the experiences and needs of diverse populations.
replacement_map.advocacy: collaborative efforts to inform policy and practice based on scientific findings.
replacement_map.\u201cbipoc: “Populations with limited access to care,” or “communities facing structural healthcare barriers”
replacement_map.\u201d \u201clatinx: “Populations with limited access to care,” or “communities facing structural healthcare barriers”
replacement_map.\u201d \u201cmarginalized groups\u201d: “Populations with limited access to care,” or “communities facing structural healthcare barriers”
replacement_map.\u201cpromoting diversity: “expanding participation,” “improving health outcomes,” or “supporting research that reflects real-world needs”
replacement_map.\u201d \u201csocial justice: “expanding participation,” “improving health outcomes,” or “supporting research that reflects real-world needs”
replacement_map.\u201d \u201cadvocacy\u201d: “expanding participation,” “improving health outcomes,” or “supporting research that reflects real-world needs”
replacement_map.\u201cculturally relevant\u201d: “developed with input from community partners to reflect local context”
replacement_map.\u201cvulnerable populations: “individuals from areas with healthcare shortages” or “populations with fewer opportunities to participate in research”
replacement_map.\u201d \u201cminorities: “individuals from areas with healthcare shortages” or “populations with fewer opportunities to participate in research”
replacement_map.\u201d \u201cat-risk\u201d: “individuals from areas with healthcare shortages” or “populations with fewer opportunities to participate in research”
replacement_map.social determinants of health: non-clinical factors such as housing, transportation, education, or nutrition
replacement_map.culturally adapted curriculum: curriculum developed with community input to improve relevance and uptake
replacement_map.non-medical needs: factors such as nutrition and stable living conditions
replacement_map.hard-to-reach populations: populations that are difficult to engage through traditional outreach
replacement_map.priority populations: populations identified in public-health guidelines for targeted interventions
replacement_map.minority-serving: serving populations with historically lower participation
replacement_map.socially vulnerable communities: communities with elevated exposure to health-related risks
replacement_map.first-generation students: students whose parents did not complete a four‑year degree
replacement_map.first-generation investigators: investigators whose parents did not complete a four‑year degree
replacement_map.health equity lens: approach focused on improving measurable health outcomes across groups
replacement_map.inclusive research practices: practices that engage a broad range of participants
replacement_map.low-income communities: communities with median household income below the state average

differences in health outcomes across populations
